title: 113_hr5474
content: The "Concrete Pump Tax Fairness Act of 2014" imposes a mileage-based user fee for mobile mounted concrete boom pumps, with specific provisions for defining the vehicles and collecting the fee. The "Concrete Pump Tax Fairness Act of 2014" imposes a fee on mobile mounted concrete boom pump vehicles based on mileage traveled in the United States. The fee rates are $0.05 per mile for vehicles under 60,000 pounds and $0.07 per mile for vehicles over 60,000 pounds. The fee is paid by the vehicle owner and can be credited against tax for the taxable period. The tax imposed on concrete pump vehicles is based on mileage traveled in the US and can be credited against tax for the taxable period. Special rules for determining mileage include close coordination with the Department of Transportation to develop an administration system that integrates with existing vehicle technology and minimizes administrative burdens. The Department of Transportation aims to integrate a system with state and local transportation revenue mechanisms, protect privacy, and allow third-party administrators to manage data collection and refund payments. Up to $5,000,000 is authorized for developing and implementing the system, including grants to private companies for on-board technologies to track road miles traveled. ``SEC. 4492. MOBILE MOUNTED CONCRETE BOOM PUMP VEHICLE DEFINED. The term 'mobile mounted concrete boom pump vehicle' refers to a vehicle that is mobile machinery and has a concrete boom pump and related parts mounted on it.`` The fees imposed by section 4491 are collected quarterly, with regulations set for filing returns and payment deadlines. The fee is treated as an excise tax under subtitle F, with each quarter ending on March 31, June 30, September 30, or December 31. Highway mileage limitation does not apply. The Highway Mileage Limitation does not apply to a mobile mounted concrete boom pump vehicle. Nontaxable use is defined in section 4082 of the Code, with an exception for vehicles described in clause (v). Deposits into the Highway Trust Fund are outlined in section 9503(b) of the Code. Section 9503(b) of the Code is amended to include a new subparagraph (F) related to vehicle mileage tax. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of subchapters for chapter 36 of the Code. The amendments related to a mileage-based user fee for mobile mounted concrete boom pumps will take effect on January 1, 2016.
